words.definition: Ability is the quality of being able to do something.
words.example: This program helps students improve their writing ability.

words.definition: Agriculture is the growing of food and raising of animals.
words.example: The country’s economy depends on agriculture.

words.definition: A cartoon is a funny drawing.
words.example: Sometimes, people draw cartoons of famous people.

words.definition: A ceiling is the top part of a room inside a building.
words.example: He stood on a chair to reach the ceiling.

words.definition: To convince is to make someone believe that something is true.
words.example: She convinced me to buy the house.

words.definition: When people are curious, they want to learn about something.
words.example: I opened the box because I was curious about what was inside.

words.definition: To delay is to wait until a later time to do something.
words.example: I was delayed at the airport for over two hours.

words.definition: A diary is a book in which you write your personal experiences.
words.example: I do not let anyone read my diary.

words.definition: An element is a particular part of something.
words.example: Taxes are an important element of the economy.

words.definition: Faith is a strong belief or trust in something or someone.
words.example: The people had faith that their leader would help them.

words.definition: Grain is food crops such as wheat, corn, or rice.
words.example: The farmer planted grain in his field.

words.definition: To greet is to say hello to someone or welcome them.
words.example: She greeted me with a smile.

words.definition: To investigate is to search for or learn the facts about something.
words.example: The police are investigating the crime.

words.definition: Joy is a feeling of great happiness.
words.example: I felt a lot of joy when I found out I passed the test.

words.definition: A label is a tag that gives information about something.
words.example: The label on the bottle said that it was poisonous.

words.definition: A monk is a religious man who lives in a monastery.
words.example: The monks pray many times a day.

words.definition: When something is odd, it is unusual or strange.
words.example: Her dress was a little odd.

words.definition: To pause is to stop doing something for a short time.
words.example: She paused for a moment to catch her breath.

words.definition: A priest is a person trained to perform religious duties.
words.example: The priest gave a speech at the church.

words.definition: A profession is a person’s job.
words.example: He is a doctor by profession.
